intro: Strophiostoma propinquum, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkweed, is a species of flowering plant native to the United States. It is part of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant has slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are typically pink or reddish in color. Strophiostoma propinquum plays a role in supporting local pollinators, including butterflies and bees.
